neighbors.name: Beau Martin & Jessica Martin
neighbors.claims: Beau Martin is a local Orleans crop farmer and auctioneer who operates Martin Auction Company with his father, Lyle Martin ([Martin Auction Co. About Us](https://martin-auctionco.com/aboutus.html)). Beau Martin resides northwest of Orleans and has been an active auctioneer since attending school in 2004 ([Martin Auction Co. History](https://martin-auctionco.com/aboutus.html)). Public records associate him with Jessica Martin ([NPD Public Data](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/m/vicki-martin/)). No specific public statements on renewable energy development were found for either Beau or Jessica Martin.

approach_recommendations.engage: Leverage his role as a local auctioneer and business owner; approach with respect for his commercial ties to the agricultural community. Discuss how the project might interact with local land values and agricultural operations.

citations.claim: Operates Martin Auction Company with father Lyle Martin
citations.title: Martin Auction Co. - About Us

citations.claim: Public records associate him with Jessica Martin
citations.title: Public Data Record - Martin Family

neighbors.name: Carol A. Wells
neighbors.claims: Carol A. Wells is listed as the owner of a parcel in Orleans (PIN 280005301) per Harlan County property records. Carol Ann Wells, 88, of Grand Island, Nebraska, passed away on October 31, 2021 ([Apfel Funeral Home Obituary](https://www.apfelfuneralhome.com/obituaries/carol-a-wells)). She was a long-time resident of Grand Island and the wife of Neale Wells ([Grand Island Independent Obituary](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/theindependent/name/carol-wells-obituary?id=32355705)). The property is likely held by her estate or heirs.
neighbors.influence_justification: Deceased landowner; estate likely holds title

approach_recommendations.engage: Contact the estate executor or surviving family (husband Neale Wells or children) regarding the property. Acknowledge the owner's passing and approach with sensitivity regarding the disposition or future management of the land.

citations.title: Obituary for Carol Ann Wells - Apfel Funeral Home

citations.claim: Lived in Grand Island, wife of Neale Wells
citations.title: Carol Wells Obituary - Grand Island Independent

neighbors.name: Bart A. Woodward & Jill R. Woodward
neighbors.claims: Bart A. Woodward is a Co-Owner, Associate Broker, and Accredited Rural Appraiser (ARA) at Agri Affiliates, Inc., a major agricultural real estate and management firm ([Agri Affiliates Team Profile](https://agriaffiliates.com/agents/bart-woodward-ara/)). He holds a B.S. in Agricultural Economics from UNL and has extensive experience in farm management and appraisal across Nebraska ([Agri Affiliates Bio](https://agriaffiliates.com/agents/bart-woodward-ara/)). Bart and Jill R. Woodward own land in rural Orleans, but Bart's professional base is in the Kearney/Minden area ([Men Stopping Violence Profile](https://www.menstoppingviolence.org/people/bart-woodward/)). His firm actively lists properties with renewable energy features, such as solar wells ([Agri Affiliates Listing](https://agriaffiliates.com/properties/wheeler-county-rangeland/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Owner of major ag real estate firm; professional appraiser

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage as a sophisticated industry professional. Bart Woodward is an expert in land valuation and management; discussions should focus on economic data, land value impacts, and precise contract terms rather than general neighborly assurances.

citations.claim: Co-Owner and Accredited Rural Appraiser at Agri Affiliates
citations.title: Bart Woodward, ARA - Agri Affiliates Agent Profile

citations.claim: Firm lists properties with solar features
citations.title: Wheeler County Rangeland Listing - Agri Affiliates

neighbors.name: Jesse R. Hays & Jill C. Hays
neighbors.claims: Jesse R. Hays and Jill C. Hays are listed as co-owners of two parcels near Orleans (PINs 280002500 and 280002501) in Harlan County property records. A Jesse Hays wrestled for Southern Valley High School (serving Harlan County) in 2008, suggesting potential local roots ([Hastings Tribune](https://bloximages.newyork1.vip.townnews.com/hastingstribune.com/content/tncms/assets/v3/editorial/7/88/788c820c-5902-11ec-b72e-e7a8f3b3270e/61b21d49bb7b7.pdf.pdf)). The previously identified Jesse Hays of Beatrice, NE (wife Wendy) appears to be a mismatch given the co-owner name Jill ([Douglas County West Hall of Fame](https://www.dcwest.org/vnews/display.v/ART/59b7e801f3144)).
neighbors.influence_justification: No verified local civic presence found

approach_recommendations.engage: Treat as absentee or private landowners until residency is confirmed. Initial outreach should be informational and low-pressure, seeking to verify their connection to the land and any specific concerns.

citations.claim: Jesse Hays wrestled for Southern Valley High School in 2008
citations.title: Hastings Tribune Sports Section - Dec 2008

citations.claim: Jesse Hays of Beatrice has wife Wendy (mismatch with Jill)
citations.title: Douglas County West Athletic Hall of Fame - Jesse Hays

neighbors.name: Gary L. Stoelting & James G. Stoelting
neighbors.claims: Gary L. Stoelting and James G. Stoelting operate a major farming partnership in Orleans, Nebraska, receiving over $1.5 million and $1.8 million respectively in USDA subsidies between 1995 and 2024 ([EWG Farm Subsidy Database](https://farm.ewg.org/addrsearch.php?z=1&zip=68966&page=0)). They are brothers of the late John A. Stoelting (d. 2023) ([Valley Voice Obituary](https://www.valleyvoicene.com/news/john-stoelting)). Family member Daniel Stoelting was appointed to the Harlan County Planning and Zoning Board in August 2024 ([Harlan County Board Minutes](https://harlancounty.ne.gov/posting_files/pdfs/board/minutes/2024/20240806_132808_board_minutes.pdf)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Family member on Planning/Zoning Board; major landowners

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach as established local operators with significant political influence. Acknowledge their long-standing family presence and Daniel Stoelting's role on the Planning Board. Discussions should be transparent and respectful of their regulatory and operational knowledge.

citations.claim: James and Gary Stoelting received over $1.5M and $1.8M in subsidies
citations.title: EWG Farm Subsidy Database - Harlan County Top Recipients

citations.claim: Brothers of late John A. Stoelting
citations.title: Obituary for John A. Stoelting - Valley Voice

citations.claim: Daniel Stoelting appointed to Planning and Zoning Board in 2024
citations.title: Harlan County Board of Supervisors Minutes - Aug 6 2024
